1. Zero Effect (2000)
This movie is about a detective named Daryl Zero who is the best detective in the world. He helps people solve their problems. However, there is something that he cannot solve. In order to solve this problem, he has to go on a journey.
During his journey, he meets many interesting people. These people tell him many different things about life and death.
Based on what these people tell him, Daryl Zero realizes that there are many things in life that we do not understand or cannot explain. However, despite our lack of understanding or explanation, these things still exist in our lives.

Based on your preferences, I would recommend "The Dark Knight" (2008) or "Spider-Man" (2002) as great options.

"The Dark Knight" is a superhero film based on theDC Comics character Batman. Directed by Christopher Nolan and starring Christian Bale as Batman/Bruce Wayne, Anne Hathaway as Rachel Bruce Wayne, Tom Hardy as Alfred Bruce Wayne, and Joseph Gordon-Levitt as James Gordon-Levitt Bruce Wayne, it follows the story of Batman, who is battling crime in Gotham City.
"The Dark Knight" received critical acclaim upon its release. It was praised for its performances, direction, screenplay, and production design. It became one of the highest-grossing films of all time, as well as one of the most successful superhero film franchises of all time.

Spider-Man (2002)
is a superhero film directed by Sam Raimi and based on the Marvel Comics character Spider-Man. Starring Tobey Maguire as Peter Parker/Spider-Man, James Franco as Harry Osborn, Kirsten Dunst as Mary Jane Watson, Marlon Brando as Kingpin, John Travolta as Nick Fury, Samuel L Jackson as Captain Hammer/Clawson, and Benicio del Toro as Dr. Doom/Doom.
Spider-Man (2002)
was released on March 31, 2002 in the United States. It received mixed reviews upon its release, but it has since become a beloved film franchise, with several sequels and adaptations released since 2002.

- Title: The Shawshank Redemption  (1994)  | Plot: Andy Dufresne is a successful businessman and a former US Army officer who served in Vietnam. After getting out of prison, he goes to work for Red, the most powerful man in the entire prison system. Andy starts off by being respectful towards Red, but over time, he becomes more and more assertive towards Red. Eventually, after working at Red's gang, Andy manages to gain enough influence within the prison system that he is able to convince the warden of Shawshank Prison to grant him his freedom after serving out the rest of his original 28-year sentence. Andy then sets out on a journey to find and help those who are still in need of his help.  | Starring: Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Bob Gunton, William Sadler, David Strathairn, Jack Warden
